verses.name: Proverbs 23:1
verses.text: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee:

verses.name: Proverbs 23:2
verses.text: And put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:3
verses.text: Be not desirous of his dainties: for they are deceitful meat.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:4
verses.text: Labour not to be rich: cease from thine own wisdom.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:5
verses.text: Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? for riches certainly make themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle toward heaven.

verses.name: Proverbs 23:6
verses.text: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats:
